content: I've added an extra test with input ending with command other than `.`

You want to give full information in the statement, especially for fast mode. It's not a guessing game.
So I added the following line in the statement:
"Starting from the value 0:"
Encountered this one in a clash, it felt a bit to easy, IDK if it is still possible, but IMHO we should add `<` and `>` instructions.

The case where there are multiple output commands at the end of the input only exists in validators. This meant that my solution got 100% of the test cases correct but only passed 25% of validators. Especially annoying since it was in reverse mode so there was no way to know...
